core.noise

core.noise#

Noise process module.

To support stateful noise with possibly more complex sampling procedures, this module defines an abstract NoiseProcess class that defines the noise sampling interface for the mp_rl.core.actor.Actor.

class mp_rl.core.noise.NoiseProcess#

Abstract base class for NoiseProcesses.

__init__()#

Initialize the noise process.

abstract sample() → numpy.ndarray#

Sample a noise sample from the process.

Returns

A noise sample array of the noise process’ dimension.

abstract reset()#

Reset internal process states if any.

__weakref__#

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

class mp_rl.core.noise.OrnsteinUhlenbeckNoise(dims: int, mu: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], sigma: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], clip: Optional[float] = None)#

Ornstein Uhlenbeck noise process to generate an N-dimensional noise.

Noise sampled from this process is correlated with previous samples, which can be useful in RL applications.

__init__(dims: int, mu: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], sigma: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], clip: Optional[float] = None)#

Initialize the noise process.

Parameters

  • dims – Noise dimension.

  • mu – Previous noise reduction factor.

  • sigma – Standard deviation of the gaussian noise in each step.

  • clip – Optional noise clipping parameter.

sample() → numpy.ndarray#

Sample from the noise process.

Returns

A numpy array of noise that is correlated with previous samples.

reset()#

Reset the internal noise process state to start from 0.

class mp_rl.core.noise.GaussianNoise(dims: int, mu: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], sigma: Union[float, numpy.ndarray])#

Standard gaussian noise with uncorrelated samples.

__init__(dims: int, mu: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], sigma: Union[float, numpy.ndarray])#

Initialize the noise process.

Parameters

  • dims – Noise dimension.

  • mu – Gaussian mean.

  • sigma – Gaussian variance.

sample() → numpy.ndarray#

Sample from the noise process.

Returns

A numpy array of gaussian noise.

reset()#

Gaussian noise is stateless, reset is a no-op.

class mp_rl.core.noise.UniformNoise(dims: int)#

Uniformly distributed noise with uncorrelated samples.

__init__(dims: int)#

Initialize the noise process.

Parameters

dims – Noise dimension.

sample() → numpy.ndarray#

Sample from the noise process.

Returns

A numpy array of uniformly distributed noise.

reset()#

Uniform noise is stateless, reset is a no-op.
